intro: Dyscritogyne adenosperma, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its milky latex is a characteristic feature, often used in traditional medicine. Dyscritogyne adenosperma is typically found in woodland and shrubland habitats.
